answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some examples that could be helpful even though the cities are smaller.
This article is about a city that used a partner beautification project to also help conserve water usage.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/303019/ICMA_Community_Partnership_Awards
This report includes case studies from a number of places where private organizations have partnered with local governments to help with parks and recreation upkeep.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/302938/Parks_and_Recreation_Departments_Partner_with_Local_Organizations_and_Everyone_Wins
I also found a report from West Columbia, SC about their beautification efforts and the partnerships involved.
http://www.westcolumbiasc.gov/documents/West%20Columbia%20Beautificatino%20Plan%202010.pdf
I also found a organization called the Genesis Group which has done a lot of landscaping and design work for municipalities. You can see these projects and their website below.
http://www.genesisgroup.com/projects_by_highlight.php?highlightName=Landscape%20Architecture
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@gmail.com

author: Pamela Muse
text:
The Colorado Municipal League is interested in innovative public-private partnerships focused on city beautification programs for cities larger than 300,000.  Please forward programs, policies, documentation to me at the Alliance.  
Thank you,  
Pamela Muse  
Western Regional Director  
Alliance for Innovation  
888-468-6450 Voice  
480-231-3538 Text  
pmuse@transformgov.org
title: Public-Private Partnerships for Beautification
